meanings.definition: The plural form of tectum, meaning the roof of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The tectums of the house kept us dry during the rain.
meanings.sent2: The workers repaired the tectums of the barn after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest under the tectums of the old shed.
meanings.sent4: The tectums of the greenhouse shielded the delicate plants from the harsh sun.
meanings.sent5: The tectums of the gazebo were painted a bright red color.

meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to the uppermost layer of the midbrain.
meanings.sent1: The tectums in the midbrain play a crucial role in sensory processing.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the tectums to understand brain functions better.
meanings.sent3: The tiny creatures in the brain's tectums were having a party.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled around the tectums of her mind like colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent5: The tectums in the midbrain resemble a complex network of bridges.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to cover or protect with a roof.
meanings.sent1: The builders will tectums the entire structure before winter.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to tectums the house to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to tectums the audience with an invisible roof.
meanings.sent4: She wished she could tectums her dreams from the storm of reality.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella tectumsed her from the unexpected downpour.
